contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:BI''' is the entry for [[Burundi]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for Burundi, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[provinces of Burundi|17 provinces]]. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>BI</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of Burundi. The second part is two letters. ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name |- | <tt>BI-BB</tt> | [[Bubanza Province|Bubanza]] |- | <tt>BI-BM</tt> | [[Bujumbura Mairie Province|Bujumbura Mairie]] |- | <tt>BI-BL</tt> | [[Bujumbura Rural Province|Bujumbura Rural]] |- | <tt>BI-BR</tt> | [[Bururi Province|Bururi]] |- | <tt>BI-CA</tt> | [[Cankuzo Province|Cankuzo]] |- | <tt>BI-CI</tt> | [[Cibitoke Province|Cibitoke]] |- | <tt>BI-GI</tt> | [[Gitega Province|Gitega]] |- | <tt>BI-KR</tt> | [[Karuzi Province|Karuzi]] |- | <tt>BI-KY</tt> | [[Kayanza Province|Kayanza]] |- | <tt>BI-KI</tt> | [[Kirundo Province|Kirundo]] |- | <tt>BI-MA</tt> | [[Makamba Province|Makamba]] |- | <tt>BI-MU</tt> | [[Muramvya Province|Muramvya]] |- | <tt>BI-MY</tt> | [[Muyinga Province|Muyinga]] |- | <tt>BI-MW</tt> | [[Mwaro Province|Mwaro]] |- | <tt>BI-NG</tt> | [[Ngozi Province|Ngozi]] |- | <tt>BI-RT</tt> | [[Rutana Province|Rutana]] |- | <tt>BI-RY</tt> | [[Ruyigi Province|Ruyigi]] |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-4" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-4_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-4}}] | {{nowrap|2002-12-10}} | Addition of one province | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>BI-MW</tt> [[Mwaro Province|Mwaro]] |- | id="II-2" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_ii-2_2010-06-30.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter II-2}}] | {{nowrap|2010-06-30}} | Update of the administrative structure and of the list source | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>BI-BM</tt> [[Bujumbura Mairie Province|Bujumbura Mairie]]<br /> <tt>BI-BL</tt> [[Bujumbura Rural Province|Bujumbura Rural]]<br /> '''Subdivisions deleted:'''<br /> <tt>BI-BJ</tt> [[Bujumbura Province|Bujumbura]] |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of Burundi]] * [[List of FIPS region codes (A-C)#BY: Burundi|FIPS region codes of Burundi]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/ubi.html Provinces of Burundi], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iso 3166-2:Bi}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:BI]] [[Category:Provinces of Burundi|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:Burundi-related lists]]
